bio: Longtime London foodie challenged to bake the perfect pie. I'm aiming to make 3 pies a week - let the games begin!! Contact: jojoromancer@outlook.com

posts.description: Trying to decide which of these little jewels will volunteer to take part in my squash pie trials (thanks @riverford!). Apparently, squash pies are ALL the rage in Williamstown ON (according to my mother). Am leaning towards the red kabocha...
And here is the baked version of my Pinwheel Slab Pie. It's a beautiful day here in London and I hope it's the same for everyone celebrating the Fourth of July! Eat a hot dog for me!! 🇺🇸🌞🎉

And here's the Yellow Plum, Strawberry and Rhubarb pie in its final state (baked!). I had a slice for tea last night and the flavour is lovely - I am such a sucker for fruit! For everyone going back to work today after the long weekend, I hope you have a great "short" week!

It was the perfect miserable, cold and rainy November day here in my little corner of London. I stayed in and baked and read and relaxed. Christmas is coming - it feels like ages away, but I fly in six weeks and my diary is starting to look pretty full in the lead up. So I clutched at the chance to have 'a quiet one' with both hot, little hands!
Le "Après" of my Cherry and Blueberry pie. I spent the afternoon hitting charity shops and the fantastic local antiques and have a new trove of cool stuff to help stage my photos. 😊

How does December race by quicker and quicker every year? I fly in a week and have a to-do list that I'd wager is the equal to Santa's... This Cranberry Galette was tasteeee - I think it was the Clementine glaze that I brushed over for extra sweetness!
Was so happy to get my hands on a lump of pastry again! I brought back some gorgeous dried sour cherries from Chicago and have made a Double Cherry pie to celebrate the May Bank Holiday.
Butterscotch mini pies with a little candied ginger surprise, to add some holiday warmth. Now, to add their hats!

I've been thinking about this design for a bit and to my great frustration, I'm struggling to get the lines straight... I tried freezing the strips, but in their extra cold state, they don't "glue" to the sides. There MUST be a solution!! 😅

I'm glad that I get to celebrate Thanksgiving twice. Means double the pumpkin pie!! And it's so exciting using fresh pumpkin (or squash), as they all have different flavours that make for a unique pie each time. Safe travels to all of you heading home to share pumpkin pie with family and friends this week!! ❤️
Tea time! Nothing like a cuppa and pie!
Oh, Tuesday... I am just not feeling you this morning! But, with a bit of coffee and a view of the bird feeder (after its morning top up), I may just turn it around! 💙

Last weekend I baked pies for a wedding. It was a bit nerve wracking, a good deal of fun and I'm very glad I did it. I followed a fruity theme and one of the pies was similar to this bad boy (who's chockablock with red berries). I have a backlog of pics to put up, so may get one out midweek! ❤️

What I love about this weekend when I'm in the US for Thanksgiving is that there's a collective "Let's get the Christmas ornaments up". People are out on ladders stringing up lights and they're dusting off the giant inflatables and it kicks off Christmas in style. I know it might feel early to some, but I fly to NH in three weeks and the days are going to race by. I've got to start building my Christmas feels now, so I'm starting with these Cherry Snowflake Mini Pies!! 🍒❄️

Not going to lie - there was a vulgar display (including my go-to "happy dance", the Running Man) when I pulled my Strawberry & Lemon pie out of the oven. There's still room for improvement, but I am ecstatic! 💃❤️💃❤️💃❤️

The Ginger Caramel and Pear pie has had its bath (egg mixed with a few drops of water) and is now ready for the oven. I've busted out the maple leaves, as tomorrow is Canadian Thanksgiving, but many people celebrate it today, when they can enjoy a relaxed meal with family and friends. My momma bear is an excellent pie maker (and growing up, our buffet would groan under a vast array of pies), so this one is dedicated to her!
And here they are again, with their tops on! I've added a sprinkling of Demerara sugar for crunch.
Christmas mini pies, with raisins, dried cranberries and lemon. This a fantastic pre-cooked filling - you could easily freeze the unbaked pies and cook from frozen at a moments notice.
In the words of Thomas Edison, today's Cherry & Vanilla Pie was "1% inspiration and 99% perspiration" - London was a scorcher and I'm looking forward to some more of these perfect summer days... ☀️
Apple, cranberry and walnut pie, with lashings of cinnamon and nutmeg. I love the added dimensions nuts can bring to the fruit pie party - if you've never tried it before, I highly recommend it!

The slice... Pastry is a bit thick and a touch bland (more salt needed!), but has a nice flake to it. The fruit could use a touch of lemon zest to raise the flavours. Positives are that it slices beautifully and that the fruit is cooked perfectly (aided by roasting the pears first).
Lemon drops and soda pops (said Lucy Lalonde)! It's my very first lemon cream pie (or any type of cream pie for that matter) and it's been quite fun to make. Don't know why I waited so long!!
Ah, she's a pretty little thing! Sometimes pies go wrong and sometimes they go very, very right. I love how this Raspberry and Apricot pie has baked up!!
Well duh... In a pie, of course! Or in a crumble or baked with raisins or caramelised with rum... Or just off the tree, warm from the sun!

A lazy Sunday morning with pie! The russet apples I bought yesterday are incredible - hands down, they're my favourite varietal. The maple walnut pie is really delicious and not too sweet. Now to think about what pie to make this afternoon...

I love farmers' markets. Having grown up in an agricultural community, I know how important it is to support local food producers. Today I hit up @thamesdittonfarmersmarket - and loaded up on so many gorgeous, fragrant berries (the strawberries were picked at 6pm last night)... I couldn't choose which to bake with, so went the galette buffet route... 🍒🍓❤️

I'm throwing back to last year's Christmas cracker! I'm flying out tomorrow and have been rushed off my feet trying to get everything done. And, Husky, seeing the suitcases come down from the top of the wardrobe, has realised that there's no nicer place in the world than my lap, my shoulder, my back, etc...

It’s Mothering Sunday here in the UK and I had a last minute idea that was going to be just the ticket. Mid-construction, I realised that it would be better as two separate pies. This, dear readers, is the non-Mothering half. I’ll resuscitate the other in May, when it’s North American Mother’s Day (if you can wait that long). Enjoy! ❤️
.

One warm Ginger Caramel and Pear pie. It smells amazing and the caramel that's bubbled up is gorgeous (I feel the urge to pick off a piece or two). Some of the maple leafs have curled up, much like their real cousins on the ground. Really happy with this one!

Ditsy Floral slab pie with a Raspberry & Red Currant filling. Does anyone know where the term 'ditsy floral' comes from - I feel like it's always been there, but I have no idea where I picked it up. It's fun to say and makes for a pretty pie. ☺️

Here's a throwback to the 'After' photo of the Pear and Quince Poinsettia pie from a few weeks back. I've been working on a new Christmas design today and will have the photo up tomorrow. I think it will be a corker, so can't wait to share it!!

I have a busy week ahead, so am taking a few minutes to drink some tea, eat a slice of pie and let the cat snooze on my lap. Then it's back to making an action plan that will get me through the week! 😃
And here's the big baby, out of the oven and begging for vanilla ice cream! I don't think I can let her down, so I'll have to take one for the team... 😂😛😂
Apple & rhubarb tartlets - the breakfast of champions! By slow roasting the rhubarb and sauteeing the apples separately, I was able to ensure these light and flaky tarts are jam-packed with fruit.

So I have a few peaches still kicking around and thought I'd make one last peach pie. But then I thought I needed to shake it up a bit, as I know I can make a pretty good peach pie already. After rummaging through the cupboard, I stumbled across a bag of goji berries and the lightbulb lit up. Not sure if anyone's ever tried this combo before or how it will turn out, but I'm pushing all my chips to the centre of the table...

The lemon meringue pie getting its top on, before it makes its way into the oven. I struggle with blind baking. No matter how many beans I weigh the pastry down with, the crust always shrinks much more than a filled pie. Plus I tried adding cornstarch to my meringue (following directions!) and my meringue deflated a bit... I might be a wee bit distracted by Mr. Robot (I just started)! On the positive side, the lemon filling is gorgeously zesty and fresh and I know the pie will taste amazing!

I have discovered that flour, eggs and butter are different in the US. My pie dough handles completely differently (much crumblier!) -really interested to see how this effects the taste and texture post baking!
Keep your fork! Made with blackberries picked in the garden and a buttermilk crust.

While in Chicago, I hit up the flea market at Rosemont and was overjoyed to find this vintage book of @pillsbury Grand National Recipes from 1955. Oh, the '50s! This Walnut Chess Pie was submitted by Mrs. Grant Elgin of Corvallis, Oregon. I'm looking to try the Scandinavian "Fruit Soup" pie next!!! ❤️❤️❤️

A simple floral number, while I try to think of something fun for Pi Day! I've got a super busy work week ahead and most of my brain power seems to be going to organising that... On the positive side, this little cutie emptied out most of my frozen fruit (cherries, rhubarb and gooseberries)!

And so, here we are - Halloween!!! One of the best nights of the year! I have so many fond childhood memories of trick-or-treating in my village as a kid. Avoid the graveyard. Try to get up past the railway tracks (a sign of commitment to getting the biggest haul possible). Get to Karla Major's for her homemade fudge. Avoid Peggy Dunlop's - the handful of crushed chips and wrapper-less mints always ruined the bottom of the pillow case. Oh wait - my mother made me go to Peggy Dunlop's, so the old woman would have visitors... Don't toss the apples people gave out - those could be turned into pie!! Hope you're all making wonderful memories tonight!! 🎃🎃🎃

Yesterday was my first day at the new job. You know what that means.... New taste testers!!! I'm bringing them caramel and apple hand pies today. Some of the caramel leaked out when baking, so I stuffed more in through the blow hole the moment they were out of the oven. I hope they taste good!!!

Come up to the lab and see what's on the slab (pie!)... I'm so happy with how this turned out and am glad I made the 'mid-pie u-turn'! Now I'm carving my jack o'lantern and making up candy bags for tomorrow. I'm so happy that the UK is embracing Halloween more and more each year - who doesn't love costumes and candy!!! 🎃🎃🎃

And here is the baked version of my Cheery Cherry Pie. We're having a bake sale at work tomorrow to support a colleague's father, who is undergoing an experimental cancer treatment. Needless to say, I've been baking up a storm!!
The Peach and Goji pie is cooling and should be ready for slicing before too long... Can't wait to have a taste!!
Flaky & sugary pastry leaves atop a super creamy pumpkin pie. I know it's not autumn yet, but all this rain is making me crave the pumpkin (who am I kidding? It's because pumpkin is DELICIOUS!).

And I almost forgot to post the "Before" of Sunday night's little gem! One of the key things I've learned over the past year while on this pie adventure is to always, always, always partially blind bake your crust if you're doing any kind of custardy pie (pumpkin, pecan, chess, etc.). The results are so much tastier and no soggy bottoms!

The finished product. I often flip the fruit on the top during baking, so that it doesn't burn. And, after it's out of the oven, I use a pastry brush to moisten the exposed fruit using the bubbling juices.

What she looks like after doing an hour of "hot time" (in the oven). It was a real struggle not to cut a wedge last night, but I needed to get the snap this morning! Looking forward to hitting up some American grocery stores next week - graham crackers, decent chocolate chips and molasses, here I come!! ✈️🇺🇸❤️

Fig & Plum pie about to go in the oven. Happy with the lattice (what a difference a pizza cutter and a ruler make!), but the crimping leaves something (namely neatness!!) to be desired. I tried the technique of folding the bottom crust over the lattice for the first time, but struggled to get it to stay together. Any tips?

I finally got around to trying a Sharon fruit (aka Persimmon) pie. I've mandolin-ed them, along with a couple of apples, as I have no idea how they'll cook or taste in a pie. When raw, I find them like sushi. They first few bites are delicious, the next few ok and the final few the most revolting thing I've ever put in my mouth. Interested to see how it turns out!

One Salted Honey pie right out of the oven! I have sprinkled the top with Fleur de Sel de Camargue (salt is pretty much my favourite thing to buy when I visit France). It probably could have used a slightly shorter baking time, but I cannot begin to tell you how crazy delicious it smells. If only I could turn it into a perfume...

And one last Sunday pie snap! I'm so pleased with how this pic turned out, I'm going to break with tradition and post the "After" before the "Before"... This is the @birdsblack Maple Custard Pie - it's my first time making it, so can't wait for it to fully set/be ready for gobbling!

Are you tired of my lattices yet? I'm not tired. In fact, I'm invigorated. I could lattice all day long! This latticed lovely has Rhubarb, Apple and Cranberry inside. Here I thought I was merely helping to empty out the freezer by chucking in some lingering forced Rhubarb, but turns out that it's a delicious trinity. Let's make Christmas Rhubarb a thing!!
Here's The After photo! It could have used a few more minutes in the oven to better even the browning, but I was in a rush to meet my uncle! Am so happy you all like this one as much as I do!

I was playing around with ways to cover up this Pear and Quince Pie.... Not sure how I feel about this design - I think something needs tweaking! That said, I like the poinsettia-y pattern. It reminds me that Christmas IS RIGHT AROUND THE CORNER!!

The Apple pie that's in the oven as we speak. I used a mix of four different varietals and pre-cooked in a skillet to ensure both doneness and balance of flavours. I need to try some new pastry recipes though, as the current one is a bit too crumbly to make a perfect crimp on the edge.

If only I'd had half an hour more... I was working on a different idea and, as they say, wasn't "feeling" it. I mooched around, this popped in my head and it was a race against time to finish it before I lost the daylight (oh, the irony!!!). So, it's a bit rough in places and my border is somewhat non-existent, as the original idea was a two-cruster and I was ruthless in my trimming....

Starting off the day by mixing a big batch of mincemeat. One of the great joys of baking is to be able to make things to your own taste. I don't really like mincemeat out of a jar - it's gloopy and cloying (in a pinch, I'll use it, but always cut with fresh apple or cranberries). I prefer distinct pieces of fruit, lots of citrusy tones and more balanced spices. I also don't add suet - I don't think it's needed.

I bought some Loganberries for the first time, so of course they went in a pie! On the off chance any of you are feeling flush, Ali at @eastdurhampieco has a Kickstarter campaign to raise funds to open her first shop. It looks like a fantastic venture that will really benefit the local community and, besides that, her pies are absolute beauties!!! ❤️

We finally had a proper Spring day and it was glorious! Thank you so much for all your kind messages and comments over the past couple of weeks - I definitely feel that anything is possible! I’ve got to-do lists longer than my rolling pins, but as we all know, “I think I can, I think I can” is a great place to start. ❤️

This wasn't an idea I'd planned, but the more complicated designs I've been playing with need to be reworked to maximise their potential - hopefully they'll appear on the feed soon. In any case, I like the effect that this sweet Strawberry and Lemon pie produces!

The Boxing Day dinner pie buffet - surrounded by shoals of shiny M&S toffees (one of our most important family traditions!). I've realised what a challenge it can be baking in someone else's kitchen - luckily my sister is patient!
What a pretty li'l Miss!! I was a tad nervous that the plait would collapse, but spent a bit of time arranging the cherries just so... Need to find me some ice cream now... 🍒🍨🍒
Upping my Sunday pie game! Apple and cranberry crumble pie with a plaited/braided edge. Keen to see if the plait holds its shape! Is it just me, or does this remind anyone else of a Yulia Tymoshenko?

Rhubarb and custard pie. I love the colour of forced rhubarb and its ready availability is one of my favourite things about living in the UK. Although it's a tad on the chilly side today, Spring is definitely in the air!

This is an "emptying the fruit bowl, fridge and freezer" pie - apples, plums, mixed berries and even a pear! Am away next week, so I'm afraid it's another light pie week. When I'm back, I'll make up for it with a (creative) vengeance!

A quick snap of the finished product (as I had places to go and people to see)... Thank you so, so much to everyone who is so supportive of this little pie page. I don't always get the chance to respond to every comment, but hope you know how much your friendship and kind words mean to me. ❤️❤️❤️
Out of the oven. There's a bit of drooping around the edge, but I hear that's going around... Smells good!

I found this at a car boot sale a few weeks back. Three questions. Who on earth designed this? And why? And when did the rolling pin become the embodiment of a woman keeping her husband under control? Any time I buy a vintage rolling pin from a man, without fail there's a crack about me hitting them with it. I'm genuinely interested to know!! P.S. Slight shrinkage in my crust!

I'm absolutely thrilled to bits with how this bad dude turned out. The plait-work has stayed well-defined and the cranberries poking through the crumble look like little rubies in the sand. Might need to bronze it for posterity!!
It's done and it's tasty. What a revelation! Now I'm keen to try some variations - maybe with coconut next time for a piña colada flavour! 🍹

Early summer Nectarine and Cherry pie. Let me tell you about Villeveyrac. A few years back, my brother and I cycled through Europe. My hands-down favourite memory was passing through Villeveyrac, where the June air smelled like peaches. We stopped at a farm stand and bought a bag. The vendeuse coaxed us into trying a cherry - the most magnificent cherry of my life. We bought a bag of those too and cycled down the road. We proceeded to eat all the peaches and the cherries in the space of about 15 minutes, looked at each other and turned around to go back and buy some more. There is nothing better than perfectly ripe fruit, warm from the sun and this pie brings back those heady memories!

Decorated pie crust detail shot, featuring my newish blind baking helper (have no idea what it's actually called!), which I can't recommend enough. It's dramatically reduced the length of time needed to blind bake a shell (compared to parchment and beans) and gives a much more even bake between the base and the top.

What a week! First, I get a regram from none other than The Man Himself @jamieoliver and then I hit 20k followers, a feat of which I could not have dreamed when I started this feed. I don't know what I've done to deserve this, but thank you all for your friendship and enthusiasm. ❤️ I'm celebrating with a BIG Strawberry Pie - 'tis the season and, like life, they are so sweet. 🍓🍓🍓

A wise friend once said, "We're the adults now, we get to make our own rules". Words to live by, especially when it comes to choice of breakfast foods! I hope everyone is enjoying a beautiful start to their Sunday morning. ❤️

Back from my road trip, said goodbye to my mammy and brother and am about to welcome my cousin who is staying with me for a month (currently on his gap year)! As we all know, there's nothing better than pie to show family you care. ❤️ This Strawberry and Rhubarb jobby (Yorkshire Rhubarb courtesy of Berry's Farm Shop in Swinithwaite) will help us celebrate the Bank Holiday here in the UK. Hope all my American friends are enjoying their Memorial Day!!

Blood Orange Meringue. I finally got a blow torch and had a flashback to when I got my first food processor as a teenager. I think I "processed" just about every food item available. Whole apple? Tick. Whole egg (shell included)? Tick. And so on... The blow torch makes me want to "Will it burn?" the contents of my cupboard, fridge, fruit bowl... 💥🍊💥

Sometimes bad things happen to good pie. I made this wee cherry turnover out of scraps. While it was in the oven, baking away happily, the Nervous Cat decided he wanted to sit on my lap. He's not too happy about me going back to work and being away all day. I let him take his time and the result is a rather dusky bit of pastry!

Made a rookie pie error by baking a fruit pie in my holey-bottomed pie tin. The first cut resulted in a good deal of juice running away (of course, I can always lick the parchment)... But, the big brown sugar crystals I sprinkled on top give a lovely bit of crunch to the proceedings!
No time to bake today, so Prisma-ed these Strawberry beauties (it's so FUN). Another busy week ahead, but here's hoping it's a good one!

It's high time for pie time! Let the pie party commence!! Turns out that Chocolate Chess pie has this gorgeous squidgy truffle/brownie-like texture and slices like a pie maker's dream! It's fairly rich, but that's easily cut with some fresh berries or ice cream...

I heard "(I've Had) The Time of My Life" today and agree with @laineygossip (my favourite gossip columnist!) that it's THE song to end the summer. Labour Day is always such a poignant holiday - full of goodbyes and promises you know you won't keep... So long summer, it's been fun! ❤️ @pie @pieart @piecrust
Happy Valentine's Day! I hope that each and everyone of you feels the love today - you deserve it. ❤️
Valentine's is one of those holidays where one can be a bit extra, right? I've gone for ALL the hearts in this mini Red Fruit (Raspberry, Rhubarb, Strawberry and Red Currant) slab pie...

And The After! I did worry the pastry might fall apart, but happily it's held together and, bar a wee bit of juice escaping over the side, it hasn't bubbled up uncontrollably... As they say (somewhere in the world), awesome possum!!

So, we survived the Beast from the East, although my boiler was a casualty in the mayhem. I’ve resorted to boiling stock pots full of water to wash my hair and do the dishes - hopefully all will be fixed tomorrow and I look forward to the best shower of my life!
.
Sorry for the disappearing act - I’ve had a bad case of creator’s block... After a few failed starts over the past couple of weeks, I decided to go back to basics and pulled out some cutters. The proverbial pastry horse was just waiting for me to hop up on it and I’m happy that I followed through. Next step? Serious pie business (March 14th is right around the corner)!
.
Mini pies cooled and just about ready for sharing and eating. Perfect for this grey and rainy day in London - let me pop the kettle on!

It's National Pie Day (to be inclusive, let's rename it Global Pie Day)! Here's a Blueberry jobby, with an entreaty to "Eat More Pie". Bake one yourself (if you need help, there's plenty of assistance here on @instagram ) or support your local independent bakers. Let's make "Patty" pies and the like a thing of the past!!
I was humming away the other day and had an "a ha!" pie inspiration moment. Then I Youtubed the Nat King Cole and Billy Preston version - man, that always fills my heart with joy!

A selection of mini Strawberry, Lime and Cardamom Pies. I lucked out at Waitrose - they had stacks of strawberries reduced to pretty much nothing, as they had reached their "sell by" date. Still in perfect condition though! Haven't done minis for a while, so this was fun. 🍓😉

I'm back!! Since arriving Friday morning, it's been a struggle. Jet lag. A migraine. So, so much unpacking. And two furry little boyos who just won't quit me. If I sit for a minute, they're all over my lap, my shoulders... They're super happy to have me home. And I'm happy to have done my first pie of 2017, a Rhubarb and Apple! 🍏
Sunday walnut tarts and lots and lots of Jadeite, aka The Most Beautiful Dishes Ever. I have an addiction and I will not stop!!!
I started to feel "festive" for the first time this week. Not sure if that's why this photo of a pear and cranberry pie had turned out so Christmassy, but I can't say I mind.
Carving my Jack O'Lantern!
Mini squash tarts to take with me to @surbitonfarmersmarket to warm up my co-volunteers on this cold and blustery morning (there was snow earlier!).

The great thing about cold weather is that pie cools faster! This is SO tasty - was worried that the raspberries might not stand up to the cranberries (those flavour bullies!), but they are singing in harmony today...
Blueberry & Pear tart, inspired by a recipe from the @bourkestreetbakery cookbook. I need to test the pastry, as it felt a bit glutin-y when being rolled, but it smells divine!

It's a Scrabble Slab Pie (um, a 'slab-ble'?)! One of my favourite things about holidays is playing classic board games with family. Of course, everyone wants to go after Snoozer, as she's renowned for accidentally setting up triple word score opportunities... I had to use a few more 'tiles' on this than you'd get in a standard set, but let's see how many Thanksgiving themed words you can make!

Rhubarb again! But this time in a fancy-schmancy galette with a layer of smashed raspberries. Adding another fruit is a great way to get rhubarb newbies to learn to love the flavour before going "full rhubarb"! 💐🌷💐
Pennsylvania Dutch Butterscotch Meringue Pie coming up...
Out of the oven and ready for forks.
New day, new pie!
Presenting Mr. Jack O'Lantern! He's got his eyes on a chocolate ghost... Unfortunately, it looks like someone has smashed his face a touch - poor Jack!

Just a quick Strawberry Galette today. I'm flying stateside on Monday and still have a good deal to do (that said, I made a big batch of pastry this morning, so may be able to do one tomorrow). I just can't wait - I'll be hitting up Williamstown ON, Nashua NH and Madison NJ.
The mini Apple, Plum & Blackcurrant pies turned out a treat. I especially love the colour of the bubbly juices against the pastry!
Everybody LOVES butterscotch! Now to beat the egg whites...

Mini mixed berry bites for tea, to celebrate crossing the 1000 followers mark! Thank you so much for all of your support and suggestions - it means a lot to me and definitely motivates me to bake more and to bake better. Here's to continuing this pie adventure together!
Little cherry and apple sumpin' sumpin' for brekkie. And hedgehogs. A great way to start this Sunday!

There was an anxious moment or two when I thought the juiciness may capsize the Big Strawberry, but my fears were for nought. Here she is in all her glory - ready for knives and forks and happy bellies.

I had planned to celebrate Mother's Day by spelling out "MUM" in flowery handpies (after seeing @followtheruels beautiful cookies (via @cupcakeproject )). But my cats brought in a mouse overnight and a fledgling bird today and my day was spent trying to keep them safe. So Mummy, you only get an "M", but know that I devoted my day to caring for little ones who needed me to be selfless, which come to think of it, is perfect.
This reminds me of decorative plates on a wall... Minus the artsy flour sprinklings, of course!! 😄 These are 'pre' yesterday's pumpkin extravaganza and were almost too pretty to fill!

A few days away and I've come back with a renewed zeal for pie. Add a holiday full of cute bunnies and chicks and we have a perfect baking storm. Exhibit C: excessively cute Easter crust decoration - eggs! bunnies! spring flowers! chicks!
Raisin pie awaiting it's Sunday night egg wash! As it's a precooked filling, it's easier to do a cut-out top, because the filling won't sink (although it could bubble over with abandon!).

I don't know how I'm going to top 2016, but sure am going to try!! Hope you're all getting ready for your perfect New Year's Eve and I look forward to continuing the journey with you in 2017. Lots of love, from the bottom of my pie-filled heart, Jo xo ❤️

Ok, so I'm not going to mince my words here. This pie (Apple & Plum, with lemon and spices) was so, so incredibly tasty. Like, in the Top 3 of all the pies I've made to date. Perfect balance of sweetness and acidity and mind-blowing flavour. I definitely need to write it down!

Ok, it's confession time. You might have noticed that I rarely do lattices. That's because I've always found them scary! You have to commit (no changing your mind halfway through!) and the tiniest mistake can mar a beautiful pattern. Case in point, I started laying out the strips and realised my nails were ever so slightly too long. So I went and trimmed them (was having snagging fears). Anyway, I'm so, so happy that I made myself do this. It took a while and was a bit stressful, but next time will be easier. What are your baking fears/nemeses?
And here's the golden peach out of the oven. Wish I could cut everyone a sliver! 🍴🍑 ❤️
You cannot escape the

I love how this turned out - will definitely play with this idea again! What I especially love are the sets of "lips" that have emerged. They remind me of something I can't quite put my finger on - some puppet from an 80s movie (Labyrinth maybe?)...

I don't know why I never thought of adding crumble to galette before?! I saw some Kolache and inspiration struck... There's plenty of strawberries, rhubarb and nectarines in this, so the cinnamon-y crumble should be a lovely complement.
Mini raspberry galette. I love trying to use up any scraps of pastry. Since I always have some sort of fruit handy, there are always options.

This idea popped in my head during the week. I made a version yesterday, but mid-photo shoot saw how the design could be improved, so made it again this morning. That means there's lots of Strawberry, Raspberry and Cranberry slab pie to go around!

Just had a slice of the Strawberry and Rhubarb pie, cold out of the fridge, for breakfast. So, so delicious! There's one slice left, which I'll leave for my cousin (he's off on a cycling trip around Europe next month, so needs to build glycogen stores...), but I'll probably dream about it all day long! 😅😟😥

I generally prefer emeralds, but tonight I’m good with diamonds. Lotsa diamonds! I’m amazed that they held up during the bake. 😀 The filling is cherry, lemon and ginger, but it took some tweaking. The first iteration was a bit too gingery and the overall effect was of cherry cough syrup... Yum! So I added in a few raspberries to tone it down and return it to a palatable state.
.

Ginger Caramel and Pear pie. I would normally precook my pears, but these babies are so ripe and juicy, they won't need much time in the oven. I also made my caramel (with half light brown sugar and half muscovado to add a treacly flavour) extra thick to account for my pears producing some liquid as it bakes.

I've spent this superb June day in the kitchen, messing around... I've got lots of new ideas and want to see where they take me. Last week's pie baked up nicely - I really love how these flowers look once brown and toasty!

Peach and Goji pie, just about to jump into a nice, hot oven. I've mixed some cinnamon into the Demerara sugar as a nod to autumn. Very happy with how the lattice looks, but the peaches are pretty juicy, so we'll have to see how much bubbles up and over!
The epitome of autumn - squash pie and a selection of leaves from the park down the street. I love the rickrack pattern (although I wish it were properly parallel).

And just when you thought it was safe to put down your fork... Remember, it's Two Pie Sunday! As it's Thanksgiving weekend, there needs to be pumpkin pie (my favourite!). This one is dedicated to the enchanting @beaver_suit . His adventures are a wonderful addition to my day - I am thankful!

It's a "teaching" Sunday. Do you know what "Up the Apples" means? It's Cockney rhyming slang for "going upstairs". Apples and Pears = Stairs. And now you know! PS. Love how the scalloped border held up! 🍏🍐

It's Keith Haring's birthday this week (May 4), so I thought my next pie in the "Artist Pie Series" should be a fitting tribute. I've always loved the joy and celebration of life in his work, even though he tackled difficult subjects at a difficult period in history.

It's December. I've got 'the Christmas feeling'... I want to bake. I want blinky lights. I want Raffi's Christmas Album on repeat. This Winter Spiced Cherry will help - it's laced with kirsch, candied orange peel and warming spices. Wish I could have you all over for a slice and a sing-along to Petit Papa Noël!

I put all those sliced figs together with some cherries and played around with some pie dough and this is what was spit out the other end. I could have been a tad neater in sticking the plaits together, but I was rushing to get it in the oven and, well, life is short!

Anyone who's been following me for a while knows that chocolate isn't my favourite, but I had some Creme and Oreo eggs that were lonesome, so thought I'd knock together a little sumpin' sumpin'. The eggs have migrated off centre slightly, but I'm delighted with my crust!

I meant to tell you how many leaves were in this White Nectarine and Blackcurrant Summer Shingle Pie, but forgot to keep counting at around 82... Anyway, I'm excited to see how it tastes - I feel like it's a good'un!!
Peach pie getting ready to go in the oven. Lots of cinnamon, because why not??!

Woo hoo! The pie party is ON! It’s Pie Day, so I was up waaaaay before dawn had any thoughts of cracking, as I couldn’t let the day pass without pie.... I know I babble on about this, but our pie community is the best and I’m so happy to be a part of it
.
So thank you. Thank you to everyone who follows and likes and comments, not just on mine, but on any of the amazing pie feeds out there. Thank you to my fellow creators, who spend time and money producing works of art that stun me in their beauty. Thank you to the ‘real life’ bakers who put their heart and soul into bringing fresh, quality pies to their communities. Thank you to the ‘big dogs’ who have supported me so kindly. And thank you to all the lovely people I am now fortunate to call friends - you are gems in my jewel box of a life and I treasure you each and every one. Now go and eat a slice of pie and celebrate!!

The first pie of 2018! It’s a Shaker Lemon and Blueberry - I’m going to work on fine-tuning the recipe (although I may swap out the berries) over the next few weeks. I find ‘straight up’ Shaker Lemon a tad too harsh, so like the idea of a hybrid that lets the right amount of bitterness through, without being overly abrasive. My week in the Caribbean inspired the design - but I had to knock it out quickly, as I am suffering ‘the jetlags’ and overslept... Glad to be back and bringing you fresh pies in 2018!!!
Counting down the days until a midnight visit from a man in a red suit... I loved using Maldon sea salt as falling snow on @birdsblack 's salted honey pie.
Super flaky!

Well, this was a hard day and certainly not how I imagined I'd be spending my Thanksgiving Sunday. So, I didn't get to make a Pumpkin Pie as I'd hoped, but will show you how the Maple Leaf Apple & Raspberry minis baked up. Thanks so much for all of your kind words - they've been a real lifeline today. 💔

It's been a day of thinking, not doing (other than this pie), which has been grand! Sometimes I need a bit of space to let my mind wander... This Strawberry and Rhubarb pie will fuel tomorrow's catch-up "Doing"! 😅

Ah, the British summer is truly upon us... After a day of pretty much incessant rain, it clears up just as I'm about to post this! But, by the time YOU see it, it'll probably be chucking it down again... ☔️☁️⛅️☀️⛅️☁️☔️

Look at my pretty Lemon Chess pie! It's a @birdsblack recipe - easily the best I've tried so far. I lost an outer petal or two and there's a strange whitish patch on the pie - I think I shouldn't have tried to push as much filling through the sieve as I did, but am happy with how she's come out!

Oh boy, oh boy... I hit the BIG 5-0!! 50k followers (!!!) and couldn't be happier! I wish I could thank each and every one of you for your thoughtfulness and support as I continue on this mad journey - there are lots more pies and ❤️s and laughter yet to come!!

I'm raising a glass of Red Grapefruit and Grenadine Custard pie to all those who woke up today longing for the sound of ocean waves and the call of tropical birds... ✈️🌴⛵️My crimping's a bit wonky - I'm going to be working on improving my pastry over the next few weeks, so watch this space.
Morning tea break! I'm heading to New Hampshire on the 22nd for Christmas, so my to-do list is massive and I need energy to crack on!

I was pretty, as they say, chuffed with how this turned out and that the pattern stayed visible. Oh, the opportunities!!! I was also concerned by leaving my pie in the fridge overnight - that the crust may dry out or the bottom get "juicelogged", but actually I think it may have improved it! It was so flaky...
The fruity floral beauty baked up nicely and, I have to say, Cherries and Rhubarb together are a revelation!! Happy Sunday!! ❤️
I was worried about how this hand pie à deux would turn out - I thought the cherry filling might make a run for it!
Mini Blackberry and Raspberry pies with just a few (!!!) drops of @Chambordchannel for ooomph. The filling smells like a cocktail and a half and I'm getting thirsty...

I made this Cranberry, Cherry and Pear pie at the crack of dawn this morning, as the visiting family members and I had plans to get out and see the town. So there's a touch of wonkiness (or "wink Ines", as autocorrect suggests) here and there, but I've had a great day and that's good enough for me!

It's been a busy week and I'm a bit behind with pie... Here's a rustic apple galette (ready to go in the oven), made with Cox's Orange Pippins sitting over a layer of cinnamon applesauce and honey rooibos soaked sultanas. Fingers crossed, my pastry won't sink down the sides!!

Hurrah!! The Gooseberries, the Gooseberries are here!! I've never tried them with Strawberries, so here goes nothing... I love these little fruit that only pop up for a few weeks out of the year - I appreciate them so much more!
I had a few blackberries left from the weekend and some scraps of pastry. And I ALWAYS have good old apples, so knocking this together took about 5 minutes. Perfect for morning tea break!
Although I love Strawberry & Rhubarb pie, this is my first time making it. Am hoping it's not Strawberry & Rhubarb 'soup' encased in pastry...

A cheery Cherry Sunrise pie. In the UK, papers can't ever just say we're in for a 'nice Spring day', they always need to be able to compare it favourably to a European summer destination. So today, at 19 C, we're going to be "hotter than Mallorca". Over the next few months, we'll see "hotter than Ibiza/Cyprus/Gran Canaria...." ❤️ Some weird national psychology there!!
Early morning pie shot! Here's yesterday's Raspberry and Rhubarb pie - it's a busy (but fun!) week ahead, so hopefully this will sustain me. Hope you all have a great Monday! 💙

Brûléed Custard Pie. I have always loved French 'Flan' - a traditional custard tart. There's something very satisfying in appreciating simple flavours. And this recipe is a doddle. By tempering the eggs, it's baked in a hot oven, meaning there's no need to pre-bake the pastry.

This isn't the best photo - the light was waning... and it's gone a bit grainy. But, I am making an Apple and Cranberry version of this on @thefeedfeed Snapchat TODAY! So check it out if you want to hear my dulcet tones. Not gonna lie - it's pretty nerve wracking! Turns out I say the word "ginger" funny and the word "bitters" is a tongue twister. Oh, and my cameraman was ill, so I'm filming solo. Onwards and upwards!! ❤️

Sweet Potato Pie - my first attempt. Not bad (I mean, it's pretty hard to mess up the deliciousness that is a sweet potato), but the recipe called for four medium sweet potatoes and I think my store's "medium" might be slightly off. This bad boy definitely needs more egg and cream. Onwards and upwards!!

It was a weekend of great conversation, conviviality and inspiration. I finally met Matt (the amazing @toplessbaker ), the lovely Troy (@piesacrossamerica ) and chatted with and bought pie from the super-talented Sarah at @three.onefourpie . These Blueberry and Lemon floral pies are dedicated to you three - it was an absolute pleasure!!
I "loved" how this pretty little miss tasted - Rhubarb, Raspberry, Strawberry and Stem Ginger in Syrup is a strong combo! It was deliciously jammy and I decided NOT to share...

A plethora of pumpkin? Or a panoply?? However you say it, we're talking lotsa pie! While making, I had a pumpkin emergency. I skipped the part where one uses a recipe and then had a panic that the filling (from fresh Crown Prince squash) was too soupy. Luckily, my most excellent neighbour Morgan (maker of the super delicious @lauganscakies !) had a spare tin on hand to save the day.
Nice to come in out of the cold to a cup of brew (tea!) and this rosy beauty... I love apple and cranberry. Scratch that - I love cranberry! Put it in or with anything and I will be a happy duck!

Tulips in a BlackBottom Lemon Pie "vase" for my mummy on Mothering Sunday. She's the best mum in the world (don't want to throw down, but that IS what the card said!). Love you loads - I wouldn't be "doing pie" if it weren't for you! ❤️❤️❤️

I’m very happy that this leafy Blueberry, Blackberry and Rhubarb number baked up so nicely, because I thought she might qualify for @piesgoneawry (if you haven’t checked it out yet, @lokokitchen and @batterednbaked I are curating an already impressive collection of pies that will never win Blue Ribbons)! It’s lots of fun and a great reminder that, no matter who you are and what your level of experience, sometimes things just go wrong. And the best response in those situations is to learn and to laugh!
I was supposed to let the @birdsblack Black Bottom Oat pie cool for a couple of hours before slicing. It lasted about 30 minutes... SO GOOD! And I have lots of ideas on how to customise!

So you may have seen that there’s a wee carrot collab going on today... There are over 70 talented Instagrammers and Bloggers participating. But, if you’re starting to turn orange from all the beta-carotene, this pie’s for you! I’m going to blame waking at stupid o’clock this morning to make this before work, but how do you like the sound of Carrot, Rhubarb and Blood Orange pie? I think it will be delicious. ´Think’ being the operative word... Will let you know if it’s a YAY or a NAY!! .
PS. Big thanks to @squaremealroundtable and @whatannieseating for organising! And check out the comments for more collaborators!
.
And a big shout out to some of my favourite ladies: @julie_jonesuk @suburbanpieandtreats @lokokitchen @jessiesheehanbakes @beeandthebaker @batterednbaked @plumluckypiepi @kaaliberti @piegirlbakes @rumblyinmytumbly_ @flottelottehaan @fortyninefigs
I'm hoping that a few flowers and viney leaves bring to mind Mokupuni o Hawai'i... Let's see what an hour in the baking sun (ok, my oven) does to this little beaut! 🌺🌺
Super juicy peaches and plums for a stone fruit pie...
A still life of trippy Christmas wrapping paper and mulled cider pie. I used @firstprizepies recipe for inspiration, but then Yule-d it to the max. Can't wait to see if it worked!

The best hearts are the ones that have seen a knock or two - a tear here, a chip there, an almighty break. Like Kintsugi plates, the imperfections create something new and even more beautiful - a heart that has known pain, but remains brave.
.
But enough of the sentimentality... I hope you’re all ready for some hot lovin’ this Valentine’s Day!
.
Starting September as I mean to go on - WITH PIE! Peach and plum with ginger and cinnamon cobnut crumble.
Pie art detail from my very first slab pie (cherry & raspberry).

It was due to drop to -17C the day after I left Canada last week and, in delightful contrast, was a balmy 8C in London, hence my 'Spring' pie. "Blizzard Watch" yesterday and today has come to naught (where I am) and I have hyacinths and tulips starting to show their greenery in the garden. This time of year is so fun!

And here is the 'ready for the oven' shot! This little Apple and Maple gem was inspired by @littleredfoxbakery who mentioned the combination of flavours in her competition entry post. So far, so good!!
There's nothing like sharing homemade gifts with friends and family to celebrate the season! These mini mince pies fit perfectly in a vintage cigar box I found a while back.

Warm days mean fingerprints in the pastry! It's important to press the pastry right into the corners to minimise shrinkage, especially if blind-baking, as this one is about to be. And sorry for being crap at interacting over the past few weeks - it's been super busy... ⏱⏱⏱

I don't know which I'm more excited about - Halloween or the fact that the clocks go back and our weekend is one whole hour longer!? It's been a busy couple of weeks here in London and that hour will get out to good use - my 'To Do' list is the biggest fright of them all!! 🦇🎃☠️👻

Ahh, she baked up better than I could have imagined. And the flavour? Well, let's just say you should all run out this very minute and buy white nectarines and blackcurrants. Put them in a pie or a galette or an upside down cake or a compote, but put them in something - they're such a tasty combo!!
Some Mondays require breakfast pie...

Wow - what a weekend! Thank you all so much for the support! Here is the "After" shot. She was a bit juicy (I did expect that, as the plums were quite ripe and the red fruit not quite defrosted fully), but am pretty delighted with how she baked up. Oh, and she tasted delicious!
Mini nectarine & blackberry jam handpies, made using yesterday's pastry scraps. The jam is homemade (from foraged berries) and is extra chunky.

One of my favourite English expressions is "like herding cats". Let me tell you, getting a photo of these Red Fruit (Raspberry, Strawberry and Cherry) Handpie Ice Cream Sandwiches was similarly trying. The sun kept disappearing behind clouds and the ice cream was dripping everywhere, but I think the taste may just be worth it...

The "après" photo. Really happy that it stayed legible, despite the U's uvula swaying to the side... The sun is shining, I have a fridge full of fruit and the itch to bake is strong - watch this space for MORE PIE!!

Excelsior (aka Easter grass) is the most fun holiday accoutrement ever. As a child, I loved how there always seemed to be 'one more' egg buried in it, if only I dug hard enough... Not sure that there's another pie under here, but I think this one will do just fine. 🐰💛
I practically bounded out of bed this morning, knowing this giant Apricot and Blackberry "smoochie" was waiting. It's not too sweet - a perfect way to start what will be an amazing day... 💋❤️😃

This is one of those pies where I let the design decide itself, as I rolled out the pastry. I settled on stars and bashed it out. Then, as I was taking the photo, I realised that Stars + Yellow Nectarines + Red Gooseberries = a very Christmasy looking pie! Not sure if my subconscious is telling me something, but there you have it... 🎅🎄🎁

I was aiming for DRAMA with this Blood Orange Curd Pie, but the colour ended up a tad insipid. I probably should have bought twice as many oranges and only squeezed the ones with truly bloody interiors (rather than including the barely blushing beauties)... That said, it still gave my mouth all the feels! 🍊❤️
Rumplestiltskin came to me in the night and together we spun this plaited Strawberry & Lemon pie. I am really, really hoping she bakes well!!

Early morning pie shot. At this time of year, I'm up at 4:30 or so most mornings. I love the light and the still and the dawn chorus. Plus, this morning, my brother and mother arrive, so I need to tidy! Luckily, I have breakfast pie to distract them... 😄

I've been wanting to do concentric plaits for some time now and this is my first stab at it (on a Cherry and Cranberry filling). Next time, I'll bake the plaits around pastry rings, so they are perfectly circular. As a first attempt though, I'm pretty happy!

Where do the weekends go?! Approximately 4 1/2 hours ago it was Saturday morning and now it's time to think about what I'll bring for lunch tomorrow and to start packing my bag... Oh, that's right. Time flies when you're having fun!! 🎉🎉🎉
Ok, the "tuna" has disappeared and we're back where we should be, with a rhubarb and custard crumb pie. Don't remember the last time I had rhubarb and custard pie, so looking forward to this treat!
I got a heart full of love and a pie full of hearts full of love. There's plenty to go around, so don't go getting all shy about sharing. ❤️ Wishing you all the best of weeks ahead!

I was so happy (& thankful!!) to be asked by @americanexpress to make them a Thanksgiving pie. What a fun project! I hope everyone is have a wonderful day, full of family, fun and, of course, PIE!! If you want to see the pie post-bake, head over to to the Amex Instagram page. ❤️
The finished product, ready to distribute to neighbours. I love how simple and pretty these look!

As you know, 99% of the time, I am all about the fruit - it just tastes SO good! But this week, I was totally craving chocolate, so made this German Chocolate Pie. It's got a gooey Dark Chocolate Chess base and loads of caramel-ly Coconut and Pecan topping, liberally sprinkled with sea salt. It's very rich, but not too sweet. Definitely cured the craving!

As you guys know, I LOVE my vintage props and get a lot of them on @ebay_uk (have been a member since 2003!!). But I also love the variety of brand spanking new baking equipment that I can find there and so I'm delighted to partner with

Thank you so much for all the kind words about my ruby rhuby beauty! I’m delighted to say that she baked up a treat, both in appearance and in taste (rhubarb and custard-y stuff is surely just about the nicest pairing EVER). Will definitely write it up to share when I (eventually) get a website up.

I get up quite early during the week, as I like to enjoy a few moments of absolute stillness, punctuated by the occasional bird, before the day begins in proper. It helps if breakfast is delicious. And brown sugar chess pie is exceptionally delicious. Maybe one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten. Like French Canadian sugar pie, but a bit creamier, and sweet without being cloying. I think this will be a good week!
I'm thanking some lucky stars that the Mixed Berry girly came out of the oven in such remarkable nick - no tears in the crust!! A fitting tribute to

It's Canadian Thanksgiving weekend, and although I'm not home with my family in Williamstown, ON, I still like to take some time and give thanks. This was such a big week! As silly as it sounds, I'm thankful that this pie was so loved and baked up so nicely. I'm thankful that @jamieoliver is such a righteous (and supportive) dude! And I'm thankful that each and every one of you who like and comment on my posts, day in and day out, are in my world. You are the best!!
What the world needs now... This Raspberry, Strawberry and Red Currant "Graffiti" Pie has been a bit difficult - it's getting hot in the UK and my pastry is getting unmanageable... ❤️

I do love Valentine’s Day. ❤️ Growing up, my mum always went to great lengths to make it special. We’d come rushing home from school, stacks of Valentines in hot little fists, to find a spread worthy of a saint: a heart-shaped cake with pink icing (coloured with maraschino cherry juice) and dotted with red jujubes and cinnamon hearts, tea served in real china teacups and, on each Limoges cake plate, a little gift wrapped in red or pink tissue paper. We’d eat and drink and count our Valentines and gossip about who in the class at school had been livid to receive a card from an unwanted paramour. Such fond memories... Thanks Mum!!
.

It's International Cat Day! As many of you know, I do like the kitty cats. And I am incredibly passionate about responsible pet ownership and helping to manage the pet population. There are so many amazing people championing this, like @kittenxlady (where I got the inspiration for this pie) - thank you for the great job you do!
.
But it's important to remember that we can all help. Ensure your pets are spayed and neutered. Don't buy pets - at any time, there are thousands in shelters that desperately need homes. Can't commit to a pet? Have you considered fostering? Can't foster? Could you donate to those who do? Or to people who TNR? It takes a community and if we all work together, we can make a difference!
.
P.S. I'm tagging a whole bunch of cat peeps in the pic - check them out!
.

While roasting the squash, I decided to whip up a rhubarb custard pie with a Demerara crumb. While I have no doubt that it will taste delicious, it's mildly disconcerting to take a photo and realise that the crumb looks like flakes of tinned tuna... Here's to the sugar caramelising in the oven!!

I awoke to an extra hard frost this morning and then the most glorious sun appeared. All I could think was that, if I were in Canada, this weather would mean that the sap was running. But I'm in the UK, so made myself a Maple Cream Pie with a Graham Cracker Crust and sprinkled it with Cinnamon Sugar. I made some candied maple pecans, but decided I preferred the unadorned pie, so ate those on the side!

As you know, Sunday morning is my favourite time of the week - mostly because there's always pie for brekkie!! I've been up since 4:42am and am cracking on with the life admin. Then there's another pie to sort out, before I head to a local monthly vintage market. Should be a fine specimen of a day!!

This is my "make do and mend" pie. I was planning on doing Key Lime this weekend, but my grocery delivery didn't come. I ventured out to get ginger biscuits (my heart is set on a ginger crust) and the grocery store was all out. So, I had a tin of apricots that was a touch past the expiry date and a box of raspberries in the freezer... Voilà!
Slow roasted rhubarb with local honey for today's tartlets. Nothing like having the oven on when it's grey and miserable outside...

And here's yesterday's "too dark to shoot" pie - a Rosy Rhubarb, Raspberry and Apple. I wanted to explore stamping designs on the crust. Once I finished, this floral pattern brought to mind a doll I had when I was young. She had flowery underpants embossed on her body and while I appreciated the design aesthetic, I was slightly peeved that I could never get her fully nekkid!! 😅
My sweet little Easter pie (Raspberry, Rhubarb and Apple) has ended up with rather demented looking bunnies, à la Donnie Darko. But I'm just going to pretend that's how I wanted it to be. So there.
Salted Muscovado Caramel & Apple Pie. About 2/3rds of the way through baking, I syringed in some extra caramel (lattices are handy like that)! 🍎💉🍏

Rustic prune & plum (with plenty of lemon zest) galette. Super easy to make. My top tip? Strain off juices after macerating the fruit and put back once the galette has been formed around the fruit - keeps the juices from running everywhere!

The jumbly fruit (Apple, Fig, Plum and Blackberry) pie baked up a treat and made the entire flat smell like the Autumn-iest Autumn ever. I wish it would last, as I have house guests coming Friday, including my favourite 4 1/2 year old. Can't wait for adventures to take place!!

I’ve wanted to make Domo-Kun pies for a while, so when I met up with the super fun Angie (@feedmeichi ) on Friday and found out that she loves him too, it felt serendipitous. That said, I think this batch are a bit too toothy - I’m not sure how well I’ll sleep tonight with these monsters in the flat!!
So, what's a bit of wonky crust between friends? I love the red juices spilling out and it smells amazing. Fig & plum pie from the @birdsblack cookbook.
Little Pecan tarts in anticipation of Thanksgiving. I love making a slightly ruffled crust...

I was so happy with the pie design yesterday that I posted the "Before" pic and sat down to respond to comments while the pie was baking. My cat, who had surgery recently and has been a bit out of sorts ever since, sat in my lap. The timer on the oven went, but I knew I had ten minutes before it actually needed to come out and the cat was so comfy... When I did move him, I discovered that I'd burnt the pie (still tasted great, just too dusky to snap)! So I made it again this morning and watched it like a hawk!

I didn't think I'd get around to a pie today - it's been a long week (several late nights) and I spent the day taking a photography course. But when I came home, I was inspired and thought I could race the clock to knock out a pie before the sun set. This is a quick Plum and Red Fruit baby. I didn't rest my pastry as long as usual, but hopefully she holds her shape!

My beauty suffered a touch of structural weakness, exacerbated by me using a foil pie tin, rather than a sturdy number, but she tastes like a summer of love. If I'm super critical (which I am!), the starch leaves a, well, slightly starchy note, so next time, I'm definitely trying the tapioca!! Next pie will be up soon!

So, I’ve been testing freezing pies to bake later, when I know I’ll have better light for the ‘After’ pic. It’s been working a treat, except that I can’t get my egg wash on evenly and end up with a piebald pie... Should I be putting on the wash and then freezing? And I know you were all curious about the Carrot, Rhubarb and Blood Orange flavour combo - turns out, it’s DELICIOUS! It does look a bit odd to have slices of carrot poking out from the slice, but I’m willing to suffer for my art! 🥕
I'm sending loads of love hearts to my family, friends and followers! I hope you all feel love and loved on this special day and that you get to eat something sweet (of course!)... ❤️❤️❤️

I have been playing with my pie crust recipe, as I am convinced I can get it a tad flakier. I used a different butter (from the farmers' market) in this batch and cut down the amount of water slightly. It is flakier, but hasn't held the outer crimp as well. On the positive side, this pie's colour is incredible. Turns out red gooseberries + nectarines look like Tequila Sunrise when baked!! 🌅

By my estimation, it's officially the weekend. And that means I need to take my pie hat out of the closet and put it on! Let's see what I come up with... Hope you've all got wonderful plans for the days ahead! ❤️

Oh yeah!! It's the time of year for The Best Nine! I've been enjoying a lazy time with my family in icy, icy New Hampshire over the past week. And I've been thinking about how kind 2017 has been to me - I've met so many amazing folks through Instagram and had such fun. I've also been thinking of what I want to do in 2018 - the list is long, but at the top is making lots and lots of pies, sorting out a website (finally!) and continuing to have a blast. Happy 2018 everyone!! 🍾❤️

A quick 'n dirty pear galette with a chocolate crust. This a pure experiment, as I just tweaked my existing dough recipe by adding cocoa and increasing powdered sugar, while reducing flour. It's quite easy to handle, but the proof will be in the eating!

And here's the output from my pie hat - mini Apple and Raspberry pies with a dash of Cranberry Bitters. I revisited last year's maple leaf design, as my inner Canadian was daydreaming of jumping in huge piles of them (in vibrant shades of red and gold). And most excitingly, I had a new bed delivered today, so am getting the nest ready for hibernation! 🍁🍂

While I have a slice of this Peach and Blueberry pie in dreary London, I am going to think of the lakes and rivers and parks and backyards where people are meeting up to celebrate Canada Day. I hope the sun is shining and please have a Sleeman's and a Timmy's (although not at the same time) for me!!! ❤️🍁❤️

I didn't really like school as a young girl. But what I would have hated a million times more was not even being given the opportunity. Millions of girls around the world are denied education, so I'm proud to support @theirworldorg 's
Was at loose ends with what to bake today, so used up some over-ripe strawberries and leftover rhubarb to make these little compote meringue tarts. Can't wait to taste!

Victoria and purple plum galette, with the addition of frangipane at @laugans suggestion. Not sure how the frangipane held up, as the plums were exceptionally juicy! Have daubed the tops of the plums with simple syrup for extra gloss.

I don’t know what possessed me. It wasn’t planned. It just happened. I blame @lokokitchen & @julie_jonesuk & @candy_mosaics - I see their influence all over this. Now I’m going to lie on the sofa with a damp flannel over my eyes...
You might be expecting a fruit pie, but I've had a long-standing date with this Maple Walnut pie. I cracked open my last tin of maple syrup - this pie had better be worth it!

More leaves, because it's that time of year! This is a Cherry, Apple and Candied Ginger pie to warm the Autumn cockles... I'm pretty disappointed. I took some gorgeous shots (10 - 15) of the "Before" and put the pie in the oven. Then I went to post one and they'd all disappeared from the @instagram app. Has anyone had that happen? The only thing I can think is that my wifi cut out, but I feel that that's unlikely due to the length of time I was snapping... If they show up, I'll post! 😢😥😪
One apple galette. I've brushed the apples with a touch of warmed honey, so they glisten. It smells great and I love how some of the raisins have poked up to say hello.
Ready for digging in under a late summer sun!

B-AN-AN-AS. I felt like we needed a “February Funny”, so here it is. This Banana Cream Pie has layers of dulce de leche, fresh bananas, vanilla bean custard, whipped cream and graham cracker crumbs - I can’t wait to taste it! But... my one challenge is that I still struggle to get my edge to hold a crimp when blind baking and it makes me a touch crazy... So I’m recipe testing different pastry recipes to remedy the situation. Will keep you posted! 🍌🍌🍌
.

Quick and easy handpies with golden delicious apples, prunes, a sprinkling of cinnamon and nutmeg and a wee dollop of butter. I love that you can basically throw any combination of ingredients (scraps!) into a handpie and it usually works...

I braided to my heart’s content and then kept braiding and braiding. My joins could have been a touch tidier, but I’m not complaining. I found some lovely pink forced rhubarb and added in blueberries, which is always a favoured combo of mine. Can’t believe that January is on its last legs... Time does fly!
.

Happy Pi Day!! Today’s ‘pi-jinks’ didn’t quite come to fruition, but I’ve been having a great time checking out all of the amazing pies being posted today. I’m throwing back to this pie from last year, because in case you forgot, I love pie!!!
Flying back to the UK with my Christmas haul - much of which, like this amazing vintage inspired @crateandbarrel tin pie plate, is pie related. Can't wait to start my 2016 bakes!

Happy Canada Day!!! 🍁🍁🍁I wish I were there, at the cottage on the St. Lawrence, seeing friends and family, eating BBQ and having this pie (but it would be made with Niagara Peninsula Peaches and New Brunswick Wild Blueberries). Hope you all have a fantastic day!!

A selection of the many latticed mini pies I made this morning. Mostly apple, but also cherry (looking juicy already!), apple-cherry and apple-rhubarb. Lots of fun playing with the pastry, but it kind of made me want one of those Play Doh barbershops (oh, how one remembers the toys they DIDN'T get)...
The l'il cutie before she spends some time in the oven.

I'm back from traipsing around Prague and Vienna and itching to knock out a pie or two. It's Canadian Thanksgiving Monday, so the perfect excuse. Here's an autumnal Salted Caramel and Apple Pie (with lashings of warming spices). I've decorated with a demented squirrel (Note to Jo - your cute animals never end up looking "cute"...), acorns and oak leaves. Sweater weather, here I come!!!
Ready to go in the oven. Need to pop to Waitrose for ice cream!

I was playing with lines today (lots of lines)! I need to figure out how to get smoother edges on these, as my most careful trimming pulls the pieces apart slightly... But, I’ll have time to do so, as this is my last week at work. Then I’m dedicating myself to ‘pie stuff’ (at least in the short term), to see if I can make a living from this fun world we’ve built. Wish me luck!!

As you know, it was Pi Day this week, but let's be honest.... For the pie-obsessed (🙋), every day is Pie Day!! I'm not baking this weekend, as I have quite a bit of work to do, but have been just itchin' to get the kitchen - there are several fun ideas percolating in the old noggin!
Buttermilk Chess Pie. Can't wait to slice away, so I can check the texture (last time, the filling split).

Or is it "Pair"???!! I used up some overripe pears, a couple of nectarines and half a tube of freeze-dried raspberries (they'd been kicking around a while and I was in the mood to experiment...), so keen to see how it tastes!

@kittycass13 Here's the breakfast shot! It sliced beautifully and the filling was just firm enough to keep it's shape without being gummy. I served it with some lovely Comte cheese I bought at the weekend, for a bit of salty sidekick.
Note to Jo - do your pies in the morning, while the day is still cool-ish, because if you leave it until the afternoon, the pastry is too soft and borderline unmanageable. Thank you. 💙😂💙
It's a quiet Sunday morning, but for the birdsong in the garden. I'm going to have a slice, put on some coffee and prepare myself for the day (aka More Pie. And Cleaning).

She baked up well!! The top is a bit splotchy, as brushing on the egg wash around cut outs can be a delicate job - go too quickly and filling gets brushed everywhere. In this case, I missed a patch or two... And then was a bit heavy handed in places with the sprinkling of sugar... But, I love her, teensy flaws and all!

Happy Fourth of July weekend, my American friends!! 🇺🇸 I've made you this Patriotic Pinwheel Slab Pie to help you celebrate. 🎉🎆🎉 It was supposed to be "just" Cherry, but I miscalculated how many cherries I needed. Luckily I had some Strawberries and Raspberries to pad it out. 😅

The finished apple, cranberry and walnut pie. Unfortunately, I am heading out for the day, so no testing until dinner. PS. I love my new red Christmassy pie dish (and coordinated mushroom decorations) from @tigerstoresuk !

The second "Not Quite to Plan" pie of the weekend (unless, of course, the plan was the world's very first ever Pepto Bismol Pie!!)... When I saw the lurid shade (rather than the elegant "peony" for which I was aiming), I decided to double-down and go with foam lobster sweetie decorations. You can't beat 'em, JOIN 'EM!! 😜
Got these enormous beauties in my @riverford box. Not enough for pie, so can appreciate their divine, fresh-from-the-field flavour!
Have a bowl of these beauties. Have pie dough chilling in the fridge. What can I say. Gettin' figgy wit it!!

Apple pie with muscovado salted caramel. I had quite a few manky apples and some cream that needed using up, so got to work. Usually I cut my apples chunky and partially precook (à la Rose Levy Beranbaum), but I've been having fun with my mini mandoline and so am trying wafer thin slices today.

I've had an exceptionally busy week at work and found myself suffering from "Pie Design Block"... Although I have a list of ideas, most of them felt too complicated (especially as it's hot)! So, I knocked up a quick Red Plum and Blueberry Crumble pie and am going to crack open a beer and watch some Olympics!!

It wasn't too bad in the end (once I'd scraped off the burnt cherry filling and cut off the one rather dark corner). While I usually prefer fresh fruit, you can get some relatively inexpensive frozen cherries which are great for last minute pie making. Plus they're already stoned!!

Salted Honey pie from @birdsblack cookbook. Using honey that's produced less than a mile from my flat and have busted out some lovely, fragrant vanilla paste. Really excited to see how this turns out!!!

Oh, did you think that was it??! No, I've been VERY busy this morning! Here is a brown sugar chess pie - I've used @grandbabycakes recipe with one or two minor tweaks (never met a recipe I didn't want to tinker with!). Can't wait to try it...

Happy St. Patrick’s Day!! According to legend, there is a touch or two of Irish on both my mother and father’s sides, so I gave myself over today to pub songs and Guinness and trying to remember all the Yeats poems I used to know by heart. May you all find luck at the bottom of your pint!! 🍀💚

Happy, happy Thanksgiving to all of my American friends and family. I hope you're enjoying a nice wedge of pie and plenty of good conversation and merriment. I've been loving all the pie pics you've been sending my way - it's thrilling to see how much fun people are having with pastry! ❤️
Working from home means pretty pie snacks!
A super special Walnut Chess pie with a delicate spring border. I'll tell you more about the recipe in the "After" post - it's an oldie!

Oh, the braids baked up like nobody’s business! I was worried for a minute when the juices first appeared, but the crust held admirably against the onslaught. Lots of you have questioned how I can eat something so pretty, but let me tell you, when it smells delicious and tastes delicious, there is no hesitation and no guilt. None. Plus years of eating chocolate Easter bunnies has made me hard and cruel in such matters... 😅 I’ve got lots of baking planned for tomorrow - I need to rest up!
.

**Competition Closed! Winners to be announced shortly.** When I joined Instagram two years ago, I came across 'tent-pole' feeds that stopped me in my tracks with their awesomeness and really inspired me as a creator. @linda_lomelino was one of them, so it delights me (almost beyond words!) to be able to offer three of my followers the chance to win their own copy of her new book, Lomelino's Pies: A Sweet Celebration of Pies, Galettes and Tarts. It's stunning and I know you'll love it as much as I do. To enter, please follow @linda_lomelino and @roostbooks and tell me about a flavour/type of pie you've never tried... You don't need to be a US resident to win, so international followers, you can enter! We'll pick the three winners on Sunday, November 12th. Good luck!!
I decided to revisit my apple tart, but to try out some individuals this time. I've made a cheeky cranberry compote to hide under the apples...

Mixed Berry Pie, inspired by Simnel Cake pattern. A wise person once suggested that necessity was the mother of invention and I've found that to be true many a time. I've often struggled with centring my top crust patterns and just thought of inserting "something" dead centre in the filling to act as a beacon. That "something", my friends, is a piece of fusilli pasta... To be removed before baking, of course!!! 😄😄😄

And remember... Don't go walking through graveyards tonight. There is mischief and malevolence in the air!!! P.S. The pie is molasses custard. Keen to try, as I always get cravings for old-fashioned candy kisses at Halloween!

While I love a juicy bit of pie, there is something glorious about "the perfect wedge"... Look at those clean edges! And how the crust holds itself upright! What better way to wake up on a crisp autumn morning (with an extra hour of sleep) than with a perfect wedge of rhubarb and custard pie!

It's Peaches today! I was going to add some rosemary or some coconut oil to mix it up, but then I remembered that an old-fashioned Peach Pie with brown sugar, butter and good sprinkling of cinnamon is just about the most delicious thing ever. Also, my mother requested some poky dots, so as a good daughter am obliging.
Early morning apple and blackberry pie. I had so much fun with last week's pies, that I've decided to continue the lattice roll.

Mini cranberry and apple pies. I always have a bag or two of cranberries in the freezer, as I never know when I might want a handful for muffins or a compote. Thought that in this instance, they could pep up my mini pies...
And, as it's Easter, I HAD to try making Carrot Pie! It's made in the same way as Pumpkin or Sweet Potato, so should be tasty. I've topped it with Pecan Praline, because it's DELICIOUS!

I was hoping to bake today, but have a wee case of "the Jetlags". And I want to organise things (laundry! groceries! post-holiday finances!) before heading back to work tomorrow. So, I am going to do a little giveaway to bring in 2016 with some generosity. I received a second copy of First Prize Pies as a gift and, rather than return it, will give it to one of my fellow pie-lovers. Tell me your favourite type of pie in the comments, and I will pick one at random. Good luck!

The BIG DAY has arrived!!! I woke up feeling like it's Christmas morning and whipped up this tribute to the awesomeness that is Pi (and Pie)! If you get a chance, stop by a local bakery and give your support those who have been slaving away to bring pie to the masses on the special day. ❤️
Spent the best morning at
'tis the season for glitter and desserts and luckily I can offer both! Deliciously decadent butterscotch & candied ginger mini pies with merengue (meringue).
Prune & apple handpies. I can't promise, but I feel like every day between now and Christmas will most likely see me eating some combination of dried fruit and spices...

The baked Blueberry and Pecan Streusel. It was my first time doing the "rope" edge and I'm really happy with how it turned out (was a bit trickier to make than I thought!). The streusel was perfect - so crispy...
Prepping for one of my favourite days of the year. Plus, as a bonus, hearts and the colour red always photograph well! ❤️

Ok, the "pie-atus" (sorry, couldn't help myself!) is over! I've just had a lot on and work's been extra busy... But I'm back and bursting with LOVE - for pie AND for all my amazing Instagram friends. I've missed you!!! ❤️❤️❤️

I found the most insanely red forced rhubarb this weekend and felt compelled to put it to good use. It’s nestled on a healthy (and by ‘healthy’, I mean ‘obscene’) layer of crème pat for some added ooomph. Having a slice of this for brekkie tomorrow can’t help but start the week off right...

So, British summer may officially be over, but I can live vicariously through desserts. Surely the queen of summer "puddings" is a humble peach pie? What buttery, fruity glory is found within! And I'm not the only one with peaches on the brain today - @squaremealroundtable organised a day of peaches. Check out
I am literally going to eat my words. Let me get my fork!!! 🍴😜

Turns out it's National Peanut Butter and Jelly day. Turns out I LOVE PB&J. So I just had to try something special to celebrate. This is a Peanut Butter Custard pie, with a thin layer of homemade blackberry jelly, a handful of fresh blackberries, meringue and salty roast peanuts. I am SO digging in!!

I've been majorly pie-crastinating today... Have done odd jobs around the flat, including photographing lots and lots of random stuff to put on eBay (am challenging myself to pay for my post-Christmas family vacation through a major declutter!!!). So it was lucky that I had this pic up my sleeve. Not the prettiest 'After' pic, but if I recall correctly, she tasted pretty fine!!
Raisin pie, ready to eat! Am very happy that the butterflies retained their shape while baking.
Individual-ish Nectarine & Raspberry galettes, before the edges are folded up. I pre-roasted the nectarines for 15 minutes, to ensure they're cooked through.

I'm baaaaaacccckkkkk! I flew in yesterday and have spent today sorting the life admin, trying to get over jet-lag and, of course, whipping up a quick pie! I can't believe how quickly the month on the other side of the pond passed and I miss my family (and my sister's kitties) already. But I'm looking forward to an autumn full of leafy pies and nippy air. 🍁🍂
Turns out it's National Pie Day. Which is weird, because there's also National Pie Day in January. Guess we just love pie so much, we need to bookend the year with it!! ❤️

I really loved this one flower design from last week's blueberry mini pies, so I turned it into a slab pie. Actually, I made two versions of the slab pie (!!), so you may see V2 at some point soon. Happy Bank Holiday and Memorial Day!!

And here is one fresh Sweet Potato mini pie! The flavour is pretty good, but I need to cut down the salt slightly. And the texture of the filling is still slightly denser than I'd like, but I am definitely on the right track. Next time might be the winner!!
The classic, slightly over-filled (but filling is good, right?) Canadian Butter Tart.
My heart breaks for all those who are suffering on this mournful day.
Sunny Pineapple pie time - another "first time" flavour! Hope it turns out as delicious as yours always look, @hawaiianpieco !! 🍍🍍🍍
It's Guy Fawkes Day, so I am all about "the gunpowder, treason and plot"! Oh, and this Apple, Molasses/Treacle Toffee and Ginger Pie. What a way to celebrate Bonfire Night!

I have loads of ideas at the moment, but most of them are pretty complicated (ie. time consuming!). Work is very busy and I struggle to find my pie mojo, amidst the life admin and prepping for the (even busier!) week ahead. So, here is a pretty simple Blueberry with Pecan Streusel. The streusel was so good, I was eating it raw... 😊

Am off to @e5bakery for THE VERY FIRST TIME! Let's just say that I'm a wee bit excited... But, as they're on the other side of London, I don't have time to make a 'big' pie, so have thrown together a little plum and cherry jobby, using a mini shell and crumble I had in the freezer (oh, these modern conveniences!). This means tomorrow will be Two Pie Sunday!!
Breakfast of champions before a busy day: Buttermilk Chess Pie, Apple and Kiwi and a steaming cup of joe!

I had my first Mince Tart/Pie of the season yesterday and it was a bit 'meh'. The pastry was stodgy and the filling too sweet. When making them at home, I sometimes use store bought mincemeat. But I tone down the richness by adding fruit (today it's diced pear and cranberry), which makes it so much tastier!
