Wait. That's it? The weekend's over? Can we all just band together and make three day weekends a thing once and for all? I could bake more pies, you'd never have a problem getting into the good brunch places and we'd all be a lot more chill...

It's the last day of my break, so I am going to fill it with fun (and laundry). Here's my version of the Magritte classic The Treachery of Images. Which pie isn't a pie, but merely a representation of pie? It's filled with yellow plums, rhubarb and strawberries - should taste goooooood!

Spiced plum and apple pie. Plums love company, so I've added some apple along with cinnamon and nutmeg and a generous squeeze of lemon. The crumble topping freezes well, so I try to make a bigger batch than need, so I always have some at the ready.

Growing up, Christmases were spent with my Aunt Jane and her family. She has an amazing sense of style and this reminds me of a colour palette she would choose. Even if you can't spend the holidays with your loved ones, you can keep them with you in different ways.
Ready for dessert! I added a layer of finely chopped pears under the larger wedges to increase juiciness and flavour and then sprinkled the lot with a mix of cocoa and sugar.
Although it looks like it won't be a White Christmas for many of us this year, we can bring our own snowflakes to the party in the form of mince pies!
Mini Apple, Plum and Blackcurrant pies with oaty crumble. I felt like getting my plait on today...

It feels like I've been out of the kitchen for weeks, probably because that's how it's been... Whenever I take a break, it gives me time to recharge and get creative - I'm happy to say that my notebook is now overflowing with ideas! After my week in the Caribbean, I can't wait to crack on when I get back to the UK next week. Until then, I'm posting this 'After' pic of my

And here's one Cinnamon Butterscotch Pie with Caramelised Granny Smith Apples. It feels rather autumnal today and I feel I should be sharpening pencils and filling my book bag in preparation for a new school year...

Putting some of the Raspberry windfall to good use (I also added lashings of lime juice and zest for a tropical note). It's not my most inspired design - it was a rather exhausting week and next week will be even more challenging - but mid-shot, another design popped in my head. So silver linings abound!

@thepiebar needs our help! Laurie, our pie compadre in California, is crowd funding her first 'bricks & mortar' pie shop. Any amount you can pledge helps an independent bakery get the best possible start, will help local economies and, of course, mean more people have access to fresh and delicious 'from scratch' pies. Search for 'The Pie Bar' on Kickstarter, or visit @thepiebar for the direct link. And remember, if you can't donate, share this post or the kickstarter link! Six days to go!!! Thank you!! ❤️
My neighbour's pear tree hangs over into my garden. I might need to liberate a few of these bad boys for PIE....
Love my vintage egg holder. Perfect for bringing them to room temperature!

Year of the Rooster has arrived! This pie is in honour of my wonderful sister-in-law, Na, who's really more like a sister. She's smart, fun, kind and can eat more ribs in one sitting than anyone I've ever seen. It's full of lovely red Strawberries and Raspberries to bring her luck and joy, and a healthy splash of orange juice for prosperity.

Happy Mother's Day, Subey!! This Raspberry and Rhubarb pie is just for you and I will hide it under my bed for when you come and visit in a fortnight. 😅 Love you and can't wait for road tripping around the UK!!! ❤️💃❤️

Ok - the oven didn’t go on today either (although I did make some pastry)! So here’s a throwback to this cutie from two years ago. It’s still one of my favourite designs and I remember the joy at capturing “good” light on the night I made it... Hope you all have a wonderful week ahead! 💙
Chocolate Chess pie filling. I decided to spike it with some brandy. Because I'm like that. I've blind baked the pie shell partially, so that it ends up crisp, but not over-baked.

Errrr.... It was an A-corny kinda weekend! I just couldn't resist bringing this little chap to life. He's chock full of Plums, Cherries and Bramley Apple for good measure. Hope you've all been enjoying your Sunday. ❤️
Happy Pi Day!! As the Brits would say, here's a "cheeky" salute to the best day of the year! Be sure to visit your local independent bakers and get a slice (or a whole pie!) of the good stuff! 😄😄😄

And out of the oven she comes!! The top layer of apples is kinda dark - I used russets, as I wanted an apple that would hold its shape. During baking, I repeatedly brushed the apples with extra maple syrup and there is some super special maple sugar sprinkled on the pastry. I expect this to be DIVINE!! 🍁🍎🍁
I might have had one of these before my tea as an aperitif... Not saying I did, but if I were to have, I would be in a position to confirm they taste lovely!

I've had a bad cold this week, so started making today's pie and then felt a bit too ropey to continue. So here's one I made a few weeks back, after I lost the photos of my original "maple leaf" pie. This is Pear, Raisin and Buttered Rum! Puts me in the mood for a toddy or two...

And here is the "After". The crust was ever so slightly naughty and pulled in in two places. It didn't look that bad in real life, but in photos, it looked a bit too much like the shocked alien emoji 😱, hence the deceitful 'to the side' pic! Luckily, it turns out that cherries and figs are as lush a combo as they come, but next time I'll cut the sugar back just a tad more as I prefer it tart!

I spent yesterday at a workshop run by @twiggstudios and @thelittleplantation - I'm completely self-taught in baking, but also in the food-styling and photography side and am keen to keep progressing. It's such a great experience hearing other people's thought processes and picking up bits of advice and I look forward to applying it!

And, it's Monday again! This summer seems to be flying by - can't believe August is just around the corner... 😩 This summery Loganberry pie definitely lifts my spirits though! 😃 Have a fantastic week!

You simply can't go wrong with a Cranberry Galette at this time of year! This little gem has a layer of apple compote underneath to help sweeten the cranberries. I made it last weekend, polished off every single crumb and then made another for our work bake sale. And it may grace my oven yet again before the month is out...

Mini pies waiting for filling. I don't have round pastry cutters larger than around 12cm, so I get creative. I've learned that my cereal bowl is the perfect diameter for the mini pie, while my Nutribullet cup works wonderfully when using a muffin tin!
I was delighted with how these sweeties turned out - such fun little pies! The sun is shining brightly and the birds are calling a happy tune. It might just be an excellent day...
It's all about the LOVE this weekend and I hope each and every one of you is feeling it! This Apple and Black Currant number is a great big edible smoochie in your general direction... 💙

A summery day deserves a summery pie! This is a zingy (and I do mean ZINGY) lemon mousse pie, with a secret layer of poached blueberries hiding underneath. The crust is crisp and buttery - this one's going to taste gooooood....
Friday's Pieday! Three varieties of apple, ready to be peeled, chopped, seasoned and cooked before going into the pie tin...

Look at Little Mr. Nutkin, happily frolicking in his pile of acorns and leaves! The light is maybe a touch harsh in this photo, but it reminded me so of spending hours as a child raking huge piles of leaves, only to jump and scatter them all. The days were just like this - bright, bright sun that exaggerated the autumnal colours, accompanied by a nippy quality to the air...

Today's snowfall in London sure brought me loads and loads of JOY!! It doesn't matter how old I get, I will always be excited by the 'first snow' of the year. Husky, The Cat, was noticeably less impressed. His morning constitutional was stymied by his dislike of cold, snowy paws... ❄️
Cranberry and raspberry pie, with a bit of apple to bulk it out. I'm definitely getting into the holiday season - I want red everything!
Nothing better than scoring a bonus galette from your excess pie filling and pastry. And, I love that these have both turned out so well - they're going to good homes!

I did not bake today. The oven stayed cold. It’s been a few very hectic weeks since the New Year and I felt I needed a cleaning/life-admin/walking-in-the-sunshine day, free from the pressures of “Think of a new pie design!” and “Will it bake?’. I remembered that I hadn’t posted this ‘After’ pic, so am using it as my ‘Get out of jail free’ card. Regular scheduling returns tomorrow!!
Hand pies for two are just the thing for Valentine's (or Galentine's)... I've filled this with beauty with dark cherries and a hint of extra delicious vanilla paste to bring the romance! ❤️

A little sweet treat (Mixed Berry Meringue) to start the week off right... I found this pie tin at TK Maxx - it serves 2-3, so is the perfect middle ground between a full pie and an individual. And it has a nice wide edge for decoration! I have the day off, so am about to start my errands by taking the cat (Pirmin/Little P) to the vet for his annual check up.
I'm flying to New Hampshire Tuesday, so thought that knocking out an apple and mincemeat pie would be a great way to help clean out the fridge. Plus, it tastes good...

Aaaaand... A touch of the 'wink Ines' remains. It does drive me a bit crazy when the outer plait doesn't keep as circular as I'd like it to - I think it might be differing tensions in the plaits? I'll keep working on it. But I am super happy that the heart chains held up and, even more so with the flavour. One word: banging!

Three forks and the open road! I decided we needed Road Trip pie, so stayed up late and got up early to knock this Lemon Chess out. My brother and mother both love lemon and we will dig in en route to our first stop, Moreton-in-Marsh, before heading to Aberdovey/Aberdyfi to overnight. Can't wait to hit the open road!!! 🚗🚗🚗

I need to check my oven's actual temperature - my pies are baking just a touch darker than I'd like (and there is some frantic mid-bake foil deployment). But other than that, I'm happy with how the "floating" lattice (coined by the ever amazing @tinkertownpies ) turned out.
Oh, I just love "stone fruit" season! 💋💋💋 The early French crops are hitting the shops and I am getting my fill. This is an Apricot and Blackberry pie with a drop or two of Chambord for juiciness...

As the spring flowers are on their way up, I am feeling floral... I decided to go for a Tudor Rose pie (Shaker Lemon with Experimental Raspberries), as I live not too far from Hampton Court Palace, where Henry the Eighth hung out with some of his wives...

So this was what I had in mind last weekend, before I went rogue with my pastry wheel... While making it, the word "tricoter" (to knit) kept bouncing around my head - it's the byproduct of growing up in a bilingual country! And by the way, she's Apple and Blackberry - perfect for this rainy day.

The sun has come out and the galette smells wonderful and all is well on this first Sunday evening of Spring. I am off to the Isle of Wight tomorrow (first time!) and am looking forwards to the little wood cabin in a peacock-populated orchard. Should be marvellous. 🌳🌳🌳

A galette is underway! I simmered some maple syrup to thicken and love that this looks like maple taffy waiting for its stick. We had a dusting of snow overnight here in Surbiton and I am craving the "cabanes a sucre" and all their glories! 🍁❄️❄️🍁

The Blueberry Shaker Pie, all baked up. The filling needs a tweak or two - it’s amazing how it can be both a tad too bitter and a tad too sweet at the same time - but in the words of the inimitable Jimmy Castor, “You got potential”...
Oh yes, I'm feeling festive! Here's a practice Peekin'/Pecan pie. It's always one of the pies on offer after the Christmas feast and this year, I want it to be THE BEST EVER!

She didn't turn out quite how I'd hoped - there's some buckling and tearing of the plaiting. But a) I'm committed to sharing the "after" shots, so you get an idea of what's possible and b) I love the challenge of improving. I sometimes pretend I'm an engineer when constructing my pies. What is supporting the pastry? Where will there be tension? What would happen in earthquake conditions (ie. the filling moving up and down as it cooks)? I'll make this design again soon and let's see if I can do it better! ❤️

It's November 1st. How did that happen?? To celebrate (in other words, panic at how little time there is until Christmas), here's an extreme close up of the molasses custard pie. It's DELICIOUS (caveat, you do need to be a molasses fan to enjoy it)!

So the kirsch made my pie extra juicy (looks like something from The Upside Down!), but I can't even begin to describe how amazing it smells. If you could imagine a perfect distillation of the essence of Christmas, I'm still not sure you'd do it justice...
Well, she stayed the course and came out quite well presented! I don't mind a bit of juiciness now and again, especially when it's this fragrant and this colourful!

A Rhubarb, Apple and Fresh Ginger pie, bashed out in a hurry before @surbitonfarmersmarket . As I was photographing it, it reminded me of the palms covering the tiger (in a hole) in Swiss Family Robinson - luckily no scary beasties under these leaves (unless, of course, you detest rhubarb...)! 🐅🌿🌴
Mini Sweet Potato Pies - attempt

Oh look at how the little miss baked up!! I left her in the fridge overnight and popped her in the oven at noon, so was keeping my fingers crossed. And I love the rustic scissors I found at a car boot sale this morning - a real snip at 50p!

Today is all about the old school raisin pie. I remember this from my childhood, but it seems to have fallen out of favour with modern palates. I'm using a mix of sultanas and Thompsons and lashings of lemon, to keep the sweetness down.

What a great day at @surbitonfarmersmarket !! The sun was shining (after a week of rain) and I scored this amazing haul of ingredients for pie (apples, pears, victoria plums, raspberries, rhubarb, goats' cheese and Hampton Court honey - all fresh and local). Expect to see these make an appearance in the next few days!

Yup, I love Fall! I mean, I love every season, but Fall is special. I love the nip in the air and the glorious leaves and warming spices. I loaded this Pear and Plum Pie with stem ginger in syrup, cinnamon and nutmeg - it smells like the season! 🍂
Trying out something new, because that's how it should be. So there. Happy Monday!
